verses.text: 新殿的榮耀勝過前殿七月二十一日，耶和華的話臨到哈該先知說：

words.note: Refers to the reconstructed Second Temple.
A key concept in biblical theology.
Refers to Solomon's Temple.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used in formal or biblical contexts for divine messages.
An Old Testament prophet.
One who speaks for God; lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 「你要對撒拉鐵的兒子猶大省長所羅巴伯，和約撒答的兒子大祭司約書亞，以及所有餘剩的子民，說：

words.note: Ancient kingdom and region; also a tribal name.
The chief religious official in ancient Israel.
Here, refers to the High Priest, not the military leader.
Often used in biblical contexts to refer to a faithful 'remnant'.
Often used in biblical context for God's chosen people.

verses.text: 『你們中間剩下的人，有誰見過這殿宇從前的榮耀呢？現在你們又看它怎樣？豈不是視如無物一樣嗎？』」

words.note: A more formal or literary term for 'temple' or 'palace'.
A key concept in biblical theology.
Used to pose a rhetorical question, expecting an affirmative answer.
More literary or formal than '看作'.
Implies something is utterly insignificant or non-existent.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「所羅巴伯啊！現在你要剛強。」耶和華說：「約撒答的兒子大祭司約書亞啊！你要剛強；這地的一切子民啊！你們也要剛強，並且要作工。」萬軍之耶和華說：「因為我與你們同在。

words.note: A frequent exhortation in the Bible.
A common title for God in the Old Testament, emphasizing His sovereignty.
More formal than '和...一起'.
A common biblical expression of God's presence.

verses.text: 這就是你們從埃及出來的時候，我與你們立約的話。現在我的靈住在你們中間；你們不要懼怕。」

words.note: More formal than '和...一起'.
A central concept in biblical theology: a formal agreement between God and His people.
In a theological context, often refers to God's Spirit.
Combined with '不', forms '不要' (do not).
A common instruction in the Bible, often appearing with '不要' (do not).

verses.text: 因為萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「再過不多的時候，我要震動天、地、海洋和旱地。」

words.note: Refers to the LORD of hosts, heavenly armies.
Literary/classical possessive particle, similar to '的'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「我要震動萬國，萬國的珍寶就必運來；我要使這殿宇充滿榮耀。」
萬軍之耶和華說：「銀子是我的，金子也是我的。」
萬軍之耶和華說：「這殿宇後來的榮耀，必大過先前的榮耀。」萬軍之耶和華說：「在這地方，我必賜下平安。」
指出人民的惡行大利烏王第二年九月二十四日，耶和華的話臨到哈該先知說：

words.note: Refers to morally bad actions.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：你要向祭司詢問有關律法的事說：

words.note: A divine title for God, emphasizing His power and heavenly army.

verses.text: 人若用自己的衣襟盛載聖肉，後來又使自己的衣襟觸著餅、湯、酒、油或別的食物，這就算為聖嗎？」祭司都回答說：「不算為聖。」

words.note: Refers to carrying something in the folds of one's garment.

verses.text: 哈該又說：「人若因觸著屍體而成為不潔，又觸著這些東西的任何一樣，這就算為不潔嗎？」祭司都回答說：「要算為不潔淨。」

words.note: Lit. 'east-west', meaning things in general.
潔淨 (jiéjìng) means clean; 不潔淨 (bùjiéjìng) means unclean.

verses.text: 於是哈該回答，說：「耶和華說：『這民也是這樣，這國在我面前也是這樣；他們手裡的一切工作，都是這樣；他們在那裡所獻的，都是不潔淨的。』

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb or a passive construction.

verses.text: 耶和華應許賜福「現在你們要反省，從今日起回想過往，就是在耶和華的殿還沒有一塊石頭疊在另一塊石頭上面以前，
那時你們怎樣呢？有人到穀堆來，想得兩百公斤穀，卻只得一百公斤；有人到榨酒池去，想從酒槽得一百公升酒，卻只得四十公升。

words.note: Refers to a trough for collecting wine.

verses.text: 耶和華說：『我用旱風、霉爛和冰雹擊打你們，和你們手裡的一切工作，你們還是不歸向我。

words.note: A compound verb emphasizing the action of striking.
Implies turning back to God.

verses.text: 你們要反省，從今日起回想過往，就是自九月二十四日起，從耶和華殿的奠基日開始，你們要反省：

words.note: More formal/literary than 今天 (jīntiān).
Refers to the day a foundation stone is laid.

verses.text: 倉裡還有種子嗎？葡萄樹、無花果樹、石榴樹和橄欖樹，豈不是還沒有結果子嗎？從今日起，我必賜福。』」

words.note: A rhetorical question particle, expecting an affirmative answer.
More formal/literary than 今天 (jīntiān).
Commonly used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 應許揀選所羅巴伯同月二十四日，耶和華的話再次臨到哈該，說：

words.note: Often refers to God's promises.
Often used for divine messages or events befalling someone.

verses.text: 「你要向猶大省長所羅巴伯說：『我要震動天地，

words.note: Indicates intention or future action.
Indicates intention or future action.
Often used for earthquakes or strong shaking.
A common biblical idiom for the entire creation.

verses.text: 我必傾覆列國的寶座，消滅外族萬國的勢力，我必推翻戰車和駕車的人；馬匹和騎馬的都必跌倒；各人必死在自己兄弟的刀下。』

words.note: Emphasizes the certainty of an action.
Often used for overthrowing regimes or governments.
Literally 'listed nations' or 'many nations'.
Refers to non-Israelite peoples.
Literally 'ten thousand nations'.
Emphasizes the certainty of an action.
Similar to 傾覆, often implies a physical act of overturning.
Literally 'war chariot', common in ancient warfare contexts.
Verb-object compound acting as a descriptive verb here.
Used to nominalize the preceding verb phrase, implying 'those who drive'.
匹 is a measure word, but 馬匹 is a compound noun for 'horses'.
Verb-object compound.
Used to nominalize the preceding verb phrase, implying 'those who ride'.
Emphasizes the certainty of an action.
Emphasizes the certainty of an action.
Figurative: 'by the sword'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：『撒拉鐵的兒子，我的僕人所羅巴伯啊！到那日我必提拔你。』耶和華說：『我必以你為印記。』萬軍之耶和華說：『因為我揀選了你。』」

words.note: A title for God, meaning 'Lord of armies/heavenly hosts'.
In biblical context, often refers to a faithful follower of God.
Used to express exclamation, surprise, or emphasize a statement.
Here functions as 'until' or 'when it comes to'.
In biblical context, '那日' (that day) often refers to a significant future day of the Lord.
Emphasizes the certainty of an action.
Suggests raising someone to a higher position or favor.
The Hebrew name for God.
Emphasizes the certainty of an action.

words.definition: to use, to take, by means of
words.note: Used in the structure '以...為...' (to take...as, to consider...as).

words.definition: to be, to become, to consider as
words.note: Used in the structure '以...為...' (to take...as, to consider...as).
A signet ring or seal was a symbol of authority and authenticity in ancient times.
A title for God, meaning 'Lord of armies/heavenly hosts'.
Often used in theological contexts for divine selection.
Indicates completion or actualization of an action.
